result.execSummary:
All charges against Cammron Marquis Adell in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cammron Marquis Adell is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court.  Angela D. Cunningham appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Defendant appeared in court today.  The defendant spoke to the victim and indicated that this case was supposed to be dismissed today, according to the victim.  The defendant then left the courthouse.
Defendant failing to appear, the Court ordered a bench warrant to issue.  The Court ordered cash bond/signature bond forfeited.  The Court ordered Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office.  The Court ordered that the defendant be REMANDED to the commissionert upon return on the bench warrant.
In addition, the court assessed costs of $100.00, $50.00 for each officer sitting in court today.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
cab

Defense counsel was in court earlier, but had to leave.  The court was informed that the defendant was released from the Kenosha County Jail at 12:30 p.m. but did not appear.
  Defendant failing to appear, the Court ordered a bench warrant to issue.  The Court ordered cash bond/signature bond forfeited. Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Mavis M.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Cammron Marquis Adell in court with attorney Kevin Brian Dunn.  Defendant Cammron Marquis Adell in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
